photo.description: Flickr really isn't the place for 90 megapixel images (this is reduced a bit, but still high) but I wanted to put it here anyway. The mosaic is explained a bit here. It shows scenes from the bible in concentric circles, with the life of christ, joseph, john the baptist, and scenes from genesis. An amazing sight. Full size
photo.tags: baptisry florence firenze gold composite highres bible mosaic christianity

photo.title: Florence Baptistry

photo.description: The 13th century ceiling of the Baptistry,Battistero di San Giovanni , in Florence. Taken with a Smena 8M- the overexposed central window darkened on the computer. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Florence_Baptistry This central section shows Christ and the nine orders of Angels Cherubim and Seraphim on either side of christ, and then, clockwise, Troni, Virtutes, Principatus, Angeli, Arcangeli, Potestates, Dominationes en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christian_angelic_hierarchy Dante was baptised here and the baptistry ceiling would have been an important influence on his "Divine Comedy"

photo.description: Angels. Mosaics on ceiling of the Baptistry, 1225 – early 14th century. Possibly designed by Florentine artists such as Cimabue, Coppo di Marcovaldo, Meliore, The Master of the Magdalene, Gaddo Gaddi. There is one signature by a monk named Jacopo francescano. Executed by imported "Greek masters" possibly from Venetians trained by Byzantine or Sicilian artists.

photo.title: Baptistry

photo.description: Our first stop was the Florence Duomo Baptistry (Battistero di San Giovanni). We'd taken lots of pictures from the outside, but none inside. Baptistries were kept separate from churches/cathedrals (in towns that could afford it) so that you didn't have the unbaptized wandering through your holy places. Until the end of the nineteenth century, all Catholics of Florence were baptized here. The building was built between 1059-1128 in Florentine Romanesque style. The great mosaic ceiling is centered on Christ of the Last Judgment, with salvation on the left (his right hand), and damnation on the right (hi left hand).
photo.title: Baptistry

photo.description: Duomo Baptistry ceiling - Last Judgment - Damnation

photo.description: According to Wikipedia, the famous doors on the bapistry are reproductions cast in bronze. Michaelangelo gave them the name, and it stuck. On the left is the bust of the door's sculptor, Lorenzo Ghiberti, and on the right is his father Bartolomeo Ghiberti.

photo.title: 2004.03.02.011 - FIRENZE - Basilica Cattedrale Metropolitana di Santa Maria del Fiore 'Duomo di Firenze' - Battistero di San Giovanni · Campanile di Giotto

photo.title: Battistero di San Giovanni

photo.description: Mosaics on ceiling of the Baptistry, 1225 – early 14th century. Possibly designed by Florentine artists such as Cimabue, Coppo di Marcovaldo, Meliore, The Master of the Magdalene, Gaddo Gaddi. There is one signature by a monk named Jacopo francescano. Executed by imported "Greek masters" possibly from Venetians trained by Byzantine or Sicilian artists.
photo.title: Baptistry Mosaics - 03

photo.description: Christ's baptism by John the Baptist. Mosaics on ceiling of the Baptistry, 1225 – early 14th century. Possibly designed by Florentine artists such as Cimabue, Coppo di Marcovaldo, Meliore, The Master of the Magdalene, Gaddo Gaddi. There is one signature by a monk named Jacopo francescano. photo.description: Mosaics on ceiling of the Baptistry, 1225 – early 14th century. Possibly designed by Florentine artists such as Cimabue, Coppo di Marcovaldo, Meliore, The Master of the Magdalene, Gaddo Gaddi. There is one signature by a monk named Jacopo francescano. Executed by imported "Greek masters" possibly from Venetians trained by Byzantine or Sicilian artists.
photo.title: Baptistry Mosaics - 02

photo.description: Cosmati floor. Mosaics on ceiling of the Baptistry, 1225 – early 14th century. Possibly designed by Florentine artists such as Cimabue, Coppo di Marcovaldo, Meliore, The Master of the Magdalene, Gaddo Gaddi. There is one signature by a monk named Jacopo francescano. Executed by imported "Greek masters" possibly from Venetians trained by Byzantine or Sicilian artists.

photo.description: Lamentation of Christ. Mosaics on ceiling of the Baptistry, 1225 – early 14th century. Possibly designed by Florentine artists such as Cimabue, Coppo di Marcovaldo, Meliore, The Master of the Magdalene, Gaddo Gaddi. There is one signature by a monk named Jacopo francescano.
